Yes, here are some tips for getting around Montreal:

1. Public transportation - Montreal has an excellent public transportation system, including a network of buses, metro trains, and commuter trains. You can purchase tickets and passes at metro stations, convenience stores, and online. 2. Bixi - Montreal's bike-sharing system, Bixi, is a great way to explore the city on two wheels. You can rent a bike at one of the many stations around the city, and return it to any station when you're finished. 3. Walking - Montreal is a very walkable city, with many attractions, restaurants, and shops located close together. Walking is a great way to explore the city's diverse neighborhoods and architecture. 4. Driving - It's possible to drive in Montreal, but parking can be difficult to find and expensive. If you do choose to drive, be aware of parking regulations and consider using a GPS or map to navigate the city. 5. Taxi/Uber - Taxis and ride-sharing services like Uber are readily available in Montreal, but can be expensive during peak hours or in high-traffic areas. 6. Sharing a car - Services like Car2Go and Communauto offer car-sharing options for short-term rentals in Montreal. This can be a convenient and affordable way to get around the city. These are just a few transportation options available in Montreal, but be sure to choose the one that works best for your needs and budget.
